results.title: The Temptation of Mr Prokouk
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak State Films, Jaroslav Novotny and Karel Zeman
results.brief_description: A puppet figure of Prokouk is shown building his house. The demon of alcohol comes to tempt him and for a time he yields but he realises that excessive drinking does not agree with his plans for setting up a house of his own. He resists and throws bricks at the demon smashing it to pieces.

results.title: The Temples of Malta
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, D.C. Chipperfield and P.J. Grimsey
results.brief_description: During the period 3000 to 2000 B.C., the peoples of the small islands of Malta and Gozo built some remarkable megalithic temples of unique design. These little known temples, together with the rock-cut tombs indicate a high level of culture unparalleled in Western Europe at the time.

results.title: The Tempest
results.creator_credit: BBC, Time-Life Television, Cedric Messina and John Gorrie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Michael Horden as Prospero, David Dixon as Ariel, Pippa Guard as Miranda, Warren Clarke as Caliban. Shakespeare’s play is about disposed Duke Prospero whose brother illegally takes over the Dukedom while exiling Prospero with his baby daughter, Miranda. Put to sea they find a haven on an island and live there for years until fate lands the brother and his attendants on the island. Eventually Prospero’s name and rights are restored to him.

results.title: The Temperate deciduous forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 1. Ecology”
Illustrates the complex network of plant and animal relationships that make up the temperate deciduous forest community. Shows the adaptations of animals and deciduous plants to seasonal changes.

results.title: The Tell-tale heart
results.brief_description: Adaption of the Edgar Allan Poe tale of a manservant (Alex Cord), quite mad but telling the story to convince us of his rationality, who feels compelled to murder his bedridden master (Sam Jaffee), driven by obsession with the old man’s blind eye. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Television newsman
results.brief_description: Follows a working day in the life of television newsman Bill Redeker, showing how a new kind of filmmaking has developed which combines news analysis with actual sights and sounds of an event.

results.title: The Television age in Japan
results.brief_description: Shows how television has become an inseparable part of life in many areas of Japan. A survey of the whole television industry is made - from its use for educational purposes to pure entertainment, production in studios for live telecast and production for film.

results.title: The Telephone. La Voix humaine
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Decca, Mike Newman and Paul Meyer
results.brief_description: Menotti’s “The Telephone”, appropriately subtitled “L’amour a trois”, is a simple story. Ben unsuccessfully tries to declare his love for Lucy, but is constantly thwarted by the ringing telephone. It is to the telephone, surely the third person of the triangle, that he has to finally resort, in order to convey his message. In “La Voix humaine”, music by Poulenc, text by Cocteau, a woman bids goodbye to her long-time lover prey to wrong numbers, party lines and cuttings off. What should be a highly charged emotional scene is dehumanised, where the normal physical bond of the moment is replaced by the unpredictable link of the telephone wires. Performed by the Scottish Chamber Orchestra.

results.title: The Telephone
results.creator_credit: Technical and Scientific Films, Denis Ward and David Cons
results.brief_description: An elementary description of the emission and use of sound waves for distant communication, and the early telephone invented by Alexander Graham Bell. The progress of modern telephones and speech amplification are also included in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Technical and Scientific Films, Denis Ward and David Cons
